page.title: 02Yelden, Landscape
page.content: The mainly agricultural landscape is gently undulating with some large flat open spaces and very little woodland. There is a total of 49 houses in the village. 11 of these are thatched, on timber frames with colour washed plaster, 6 are 17th Century slate roofed and the rest are a mixture of Victorian red brick and modern i.e. 1960's and 1970's. 13 of the houses are listed as Grade 2 Buildings by the Department of the Environment. Several of the thatched cottages have recently been re-thatched in combed wheat straw at a cost of approximately Â£4,000. There are 2 Council bungalows dated 1947, one of which is now privately owned.
